name: Crisp Pork With Scrambled Eggs and Yellow Chives
description: This recipe came to The Times from Charles Phan, chef at the Slanted Door in San Francisco. You can substitute green Chinese chives for yellow Chinese chives (which are available at Asian markets), but you will lose some of the spiciness.
keywords: chives, eggs, pork shoulder, main course
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons yellow Chinese chives cut into 1-inch strips
4 eggs, beaten with a pinch of salt

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the pork, fish sauce, oil and a pinch of salt and pepper.

In a nonstick sauté pan set over medium-high heat, brown the pork until crisp and no longer pink. Add the chives and cook 1 minute more. Reduce the heat to medium, add the eggs and stir them around the pan until the eggs set. Accompany with white rice and gai lan with anchovies.
